intro: Dianthus polymorphus, commonly known as the variable carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors, including pink, red, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are often used in ornamental gardening. Dianthus polymorphus is a short-lived perennial that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.
